snippet.title: Space Harrier Commercial (subs) [1986, SMS]
snippet.description: Space Harrier is an early example of what has now been termed the "on-rails" shooter - one in which the game is played from a "third-person" perspective firing "into" the screen. This was not the first game of its kind - Sega themselves had experimented with the idea in Buck Rogers: Planet of Zoom in 1982, however Space Harrier is thought to have been the first significant release in this new sub-genre, and in turn went on to inspire many games, Sega or otherwise, made since. The Master System is notable for being fairly accurate to the arcade original, at least in comparison to some of the other truly terrible ports in the 80s.
